oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Syntheses and characterization of ten-membered cyclic and large bite acyclic bis(phosphines)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BALAKRISHNA, MS
PANDA, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: transition-metal chemistry
phosphorus-based ligands
molecular-structure
crystal-structure
complexes
hydroformylation
ruthenium(ii)
palladium(ii)
platinum(ii)
ph
acyclic
heterocycles
phosphorochloridites
tervalent phosphorus centers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reaction of bis(dichlorophosphino)aniline with CH2 bridged bis(phenols) or substituted diamine gives the 10-membered heterocyclic phosphorochloridities in quantitative yield. The bis(phenols) also react with chlorodiphenylphosphine to afford the bulky acyclic bis(phosphinites).
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PHOSPHORUS SULFUR AND SILICON AND THE RELATED ELEMENTS, 178(6), 1391-1396
